definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: It/The rain bucketed down all afternoon .
The football match had to hold off for about half an hour because of a driving rain.
sentences.chinese: 一場瓢潑大雨使足球比賽被迫推遲了半個小時。

sentences.english: The rain's been bucketing down all evening.
sentences.chinese: 瓢潑大雨已下了一整夜。
瓢潑大雨阻礙了我們的旅行。

sentences.english: The pounding rain began in the middle of the night.
sentences.chinese: 半夜時分，下起了瓢潑大雨。

sentences.english: It was raining dogs and cats when he came home, so he looked like a drowned rat.
sentences.chinese: 他回來時正下着瓢潑大雨，所以他看上去像個落湯雞。

sentences.english: WHEN caught in pouring rain without an umbrella, most people pick up their pace.
sentences.chinese: 沒帶雨傘卻遭遇瓢潑大雨，多數人會加快腳步。

sentences.english: The rain commenced pouring violently down.
sentences.chinese: 瓢潑大雨猛烈地下了起來。
